title: Josh Taylor beats Regis Prograis to claim super-lightweight supremacy
text:

Josh Taylor has secured super-lightweight supremacy after beating Regis Prograis.

The judges called it 114-114, 115-113, 117-112 to give Taylor the majority decision win on an emotional night at the O2 in London, as the Scot dedicated victory to his late father who passed away last year.

Taylor was hoisted into the air by trainer Shane McGuigan as he unified the WBA and IBF belts, to the delight of the home crowd.

He also lifted the Muhammad Ali Trophy with victory, with the showdown also acting as the final of the division's World Boxing Super Series.

Taylor survived scares along the way and was even rocked in the final round, as he dealt with a horror swelling over his right eye.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Unification of world titles comes remarkably in just the 16th fight of Taylor's career, while Prograis tasted defeat for the first time in his 25th outing.

Taylor told Sky Sports: "What a fight, Regis is a great champion, but the best man won.

"He was very good, very strong and had good timing, but I knew I could get to him inside. He lived up to his name and he is a great fighter.

"I knew I could beat him with the jab alone, but he had me himself so respect to him."

(Image: PA)

Prograis added: "The better man won on the night. No excuses, but I will be back. I am pretty sure Josh enjoyed it, hopefully we can do part two."

Prograis had got off to a positive start and was finding his southpaw jab to be his best weapon, enjoying success as he rocked the Scot.

Despite having height and reach advantage, Taylor was finding his best offence was coming as he got in close to Prograis as the momentum slowly shifted back his way.

But every time that Taylor connected with his left, Prograis was shaking it off and insisting it was not bothering him.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

One cute counter jab rocked the New Orleans native in the fifth and it was from there that Taylor began to dominate.

A right hook at the start of the seventh got the crowd going, but a big left in the eighth reminded Taylor that the job was not done.

Both men were cut in the closing stages and Prograis caused further damage in the final round, but Taylor was able to hold on to get the nod by the judges.
description: Taylor secured a fairytale victory in front of a sell-out crowd cheering him on at the O2 Arena in London
